actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

official_title: A bill to promote fairness and certainty in sentencing, eliminate unwarranted disparity in sentencing, improve the administration of justice, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Uniform Sentencing Act of 1982 - Requires the Judicial Conference of the United States to prescribe sentencing guidelines for Federal judges to use in determining criminal sentences. Provides that the guidelines and a statement of their expected impact be submitted to Congress. Specifies criteria for the payment of fines and for terms of imprisonment. Establishes within the Judicial Conference a Committee on Sentencing made up of seven appointed members with a variety of backgrounds and interests in the Federal criminal justice system.

titles.title: A bill to promote fairness and certainty in sentencing, eliminate unwarranted disparity in sentencing, improve the administration of justice, and for other purposes.
